definition[0]: a light frame covered in coloured paper or plastic that you let fly in the air on the end of one or two long strings
definition[1]: a type of hawk (=bird that eats small animals)
definition[3]: to raise the cost of something
example[0]: Soaring medical costs keep kiting up insurance premiums.
definition[4]: to obtain money using an illegal cheque
definition[5]: to make a suggestion, often an unusual one, to find out what people think of it
example[1]: He used his speech to fly a policy kite.
definition[6]: to write cheques for more than the amount in the related account
example[2]: Members of the society had kited more than 8,000 checks in a single year.
example[3]: drug-related crimes, like kiting checks to buy drugs
